item.title: GetTextAtEx help
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Janilabo, post:6, topic:33601”]The Un-Named, you can…

From SCAR Manual:

function LoadCharsFromFont2(fontname: string; fontsize: Integer; fontbold, fontitalic, fontunderline, fontstrike: Boolean): Integer; - Load characters from Windows font in memory. Example: c:= LoadCharsFromFont2('Courier New', 10, False, False, False, False);

Yes, damn hard to figure out how to play with text. I somehow already figured it out, but still having some problems… Not scripting for RuneScape either. Other game.[/quote]

Oh well. That’s never worked for me.

Read full topic

item.title: GetTextAtEx help
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

The Un-Named, you can…

From SCAR Manual:

function LoadCharsFromFont2(fontname: string; fontsize: Integer; fontbold, fontitalic, fontunderline, fontstrike: Boolean): Integer; - Load characters from Windows font in memory. Example: c:= LoadCharsFromFont2('Courier New', 10, False, False, False, False);

Yes, damn hard to figure out how to play with text. I somehow already figured it out, but still having some problems… Not scripting for RuneScape either. Other game.

item.title: GetTextAtEx help
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You can’t use Courier New, go to C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03 then you see example charschat, that’s the fonts you can use.

item.title: GetTextAtEx help
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

Try this. Open IE and go to www.google.co.uk. foxus Scar on IE and clcik run. It should find the word IMAGES.

[scar]//drag crosshair to an IE copy of google.co.uk
program New;
var
c, c1: Integer;
x, y: Integer;
begin
Sleep(4000);
//load non-bold script font
c:= LoadCharsFromFont2(‘Arial’, 10, False, False, True, False);
if(IsTextInAreaEx(15, 136, 983, 610, x, y, ‘Images’, 10, c, False, False, 0, 0, 13369344))then
begin
Writeln(‘yay, found “Images” at x=’ + IntToStr(x) + ‘, y=’ + IntToStr(y));
end else
begin
Writeln(‘hmm somehtings fucked make sure oyu have focused scar and the are specified is correct’);
end;
end.[/scar]

you are using the wrong function, you want to find text in an area, not at a specific point.

What game are you trying to use this for?

Read full topic

item.title: GetTextAtEx help
item.dc:creator: @rhijaen rhijaen
item.description:
@rhijaen wrote:

Scripting for another game…

I still can’t get GetTextAtEx to return the true value of a string.

To test, I am trying it on some text in notepad. I have notepad maximized and i set the x,y co-ordinates to 0,0 which is the topleft corner of the string.

program New; var c:integer; begin c:= LoadCharsFromFont2('Courier New', 10, False, False, False, False); Writeln(GetTextAtEx(0,0,0,c,False,False,0,0,-1,20,True,tr_AllChars)); end.

Not really sure whats wrong here…

Read full topic
